title: Israel to intensify Gaza bombardment following arrival of relief convoy
description: UN chief Antonio Guterres pleaded Saturday for a 'humanitarian ceasefire' in the war between Israel and Hamas militants that has devastated much of Gaza, demanding 'action to end this godawful nightmare'.

title: What is the Palestinian Islamic Jihad, Hamas' unpredictable radical ally?
description: Israel has accused the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ) of being behind the rocket attack that caused an explosion at Al-Ahli hospital. The second largest armed movement in the Gaza Strip maintains an uncompromising stance in its armed struggle against Israel and is also expanding its influence in the West Bank.

title: Rugby World Cup: South Africa edges out England to secure spot in the final
description: South Africa's thrilling 16-15 victory over England at the Stade de France on Saturday has set the stage for a Rugby World Cup final showdown against New Zealand next weekend.

title: Argentina: Presidential candidate Javier Milei triggers a currency crisis
description: A few days before the October 22 vote, the candidate equated the national currency, equating it to 'excrement', causing it to plummet. These remarks were intended to justify his flagship proposal: the dollarization of the economy.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: The Springboks, South Africa's 'light at the end of the tunnel'
description: The South African team faces England in the World Cup semi-finals on Saturday. In a country plagued by unemployment, poverty and crime, their matches − and their successes − are a source of hope and unity.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Tensions flare in European countries
description: In Berlin, a synagogue was targeted by Molotov cocktails on Wednesday. Anti-Semitic inscriptions and threats were also reported in Spain and the UK.

title: Caesar cannons have become the French army's showpiece
description: The French president's call to increase French arms production is taking shape with the new organization of Caesar gun manufacture. On Monday, the six latest guns were presented to the armed forces minister at the Nexter plant in Roanne.

title: English football icon Bobby Charlton dies aged 86
description: The Manchester United great, described by the club as a 'giant of the game,' died at the age of 86, his family said on Saturday.

title: Rugby World Cup 2023: Against South Africa, England gambles on 'winning ugly'
description: The last remaining representative of the Northern Hemisphere in the World Cup, England faces the defending champions South Africa on Saturday for a place in the final, despite their crude play and their status as 'public enemy number 1' in France.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Egypt regains role of key mediator
description: Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi organized a 'peace summit' with Arab and European leaders on Saturday. Through its diplomatic efforts, Egypt intends to establish itself as a key player in the crisis triggered by the war between Hamas and Israel.

title: In the name of the Father, the Son and your pet
description: Some products and practices, born in the United States, are spreading around the globe. In her column, Le Monde's Guillemette Faure examines the unusual New York practice of blessing animals of all shapes and sizes.

title: Russian strikes in Ukraine kill three, wound four
description: Russia struck areas of eastern and southern Ukraine with artillery and missiles on Friday and Saturday, killing at least three people, local Ukrainian officials said.

title: Storm Babet batters northern Europe, killing at least 4 people
description: A disastrous storm battered Britain, northern Germany and southern Scandinavia on Saturday for a third day, causing floods, power outages, and evacuations and leaving at least four dead.

title: France stuns Women's Rugby World Champions New Zealand with surprise win
description: The French claimed an early lead and defended it bravely, making more than 200 tackles to snatch a first-ever win over the Black Ferns on New Zealand soil on Saturday.

title: UK announces emergency plan to relieve prison overcrowding
description: The British secretary of state for justice said that thousands of prisoners in England and Wales would have their sentences shortened by 18 days.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Iran's perilous strategy
description: Tehran is increasing its explicit threats against Israel, but fears an escalation of the conflict.

title: Brussels attack reveals, once again, shortcomings of Belgian justice system
description: The terrorist responsible for the deaths of two Swedish fans had a pending extradition request from Tunisia, which Belgium failed to process. This oversight led to the resignation of the Belgian justice minister on Friday, who deemed it 'an unacceptable error.'

title: Rugby World Cup: New Zealand sweep Argentina aside with ease to reach their fifth-ever final
description: New Zealand's 44-6 semi-final victory over Argentina was enough to book their place in the World Cup Final. On Saturday, October 28, they will face either England or South Africa.

title: Humanitarian aid enters Gaza as Rafah crossing bordering Egypt opens
description: Trucks carrying aid for war-torn Gaza started passing into the Rafah border crossing from Egypt on Saturday, a security source and an Egyptian Red Crescent official said.

title: Russia uses war in Gaza to weaken support for Ukraine
description: Moscow sees the conflict as an opportunity to turn accusations leveled against it, often citing international law and crimes against civilians, back against the 'collective West.'

title: One Israeli family shares how their ideal kibbutz life turned to terror
description: Patrick Spitz, who's French-Israeli, and his family had their lives turned upside down on October 7 when Hamas launched a terrorist attack. They were forced to flee the two villages where their children had grown up.

title: Niger: Macron calls for immediate release of deposed President Mohamed Bazoum
description: On Thursday evening, Niger's military rulers claimed that Bazoum had 'tried to escape', which was denied by his lawyers.
